title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 October 2015 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
01:53 <evalica> has quit  
06:01 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis> has quit  
07:17 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
07:52 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <Ramona1> has quit  
09:01 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <vmassol> Good morning. FYI I've fixed the sonar job issue on ci.xwiki.org  
09:04 <vmassol> I probably caused this build failure, checking it: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-store-filesystem-attachments/1936/testReport/  
09:06 <vmassol> hmm they all pass locally  
09:06 <vmassol> "Caused by: java.util.zip.ZipException: invalid block type  
09:06 <vmassol> "  
09:06 <vmassol> looks like some other issue  
09:07 <vmassol> restarting build to verify  
09:08 <vmassol> hmm success so it's a false positive  
09:08 <vmassol> adding it to the list of false positive  
09:11 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <Enygma`> [ANN] BFD#88 has started. Enjoy bug hunting :)  
10:24 <Ramona1> has quit  
10:54 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <Trefex> has quit  
12:57 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <Trefex> has quit  
13:06 <irctc601> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <benedict> has joined #xwiki  
13:52 <benedict> hi folks, i am using xwiki 7.2 (newbie) and i would like to map my ldap groups into xwiki, is that possible?  
13:52 <vmassol> hi benedict, it sure is :)  
13:52 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HLDAPAuthentication  
13:53 <vmassol> and http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP+Application if you wish a UI  
13:56 <benedict> vmassol: cool, what attribute do i have to use? xwiki.authentication.ldap.fields\_mapping or xwiki.authentication.ldap.group\_mapping? I am a bit confused, because in the docs it says for the second entry "Maps XWiki groups to LDAP groups". Shouldnt it be the other way round?  
13:56 <vmassol> no idea, I've never used this feature  
13:56 <vmassol> maybe someone else on this channel can help if the doc is unclear  
13:57 <vmassol> but if you wish to map groups it seems "xwiki.authentication.ldap.group\_mapping" would be the one  
13:57 <vmassol> the other one seems to be for mapping other fields  
13:58 <benedict> i will try it, thanks :)  
13:58 <vmassol> the master is ldap  
13:58 <vmassol> xwiki is just syncing with it  
13:58 <vmassol> so we map xwiki groups to existing ldap groups  
14:43 <irctc601> has quit  
14:44 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <Ramona1> has quit  
14:59 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:59 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:13 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:31 <msmeria> has quit  
16:32 <vmassol> fyi I'm working on creating a test fwk for writing unit tests for wiki pages  
16:34 <vmassol> (and I'm getting close to a first version)  
16:59 <woshilapin> Hi devs, I'm confident to find Maven guru here (but please don't judge my weird set up, I tried to avoid but I'm not alone on this project)  
16:59 <woshilapin> I built a maven module (mvn clean install)  
16:59 <woshilapin> Everything's ok  
16:59 <woshilapin> Then, on another folder  
16:59 <woshilapin> I tried also to build  
17:00 <woshilapin> The second folder depend on the JAR from the first  
17:00 <woshilapin> And then, I reach a 'Failure to find artifact'  
17:00 <woshilapin> However, I checked in my ~/.m2 and the jar exists...  
17:01 <woshilapin> It seems that Maven 3 don't want to look in the local repository (for reproducability of builds)  
17:02 <woshilapin> Does it look like this is this "feature" of Maven 3 problem? If yes, can I solve that?  
17:03 <woshilapin> (just to make it clear, the 2 folders are not in the same maven project, it's NOT a subfolder in the same project)  
17:06 <tmortagne> woshilapin: this sounds weird actually to me but I'm not an expert, just using it a lot  
17:06 <tmortagne> what happen with -o ?  
17:07 <vmassol> woshilapin: maybe you have an error in the dep  
17:07 <vmassol> you think it goes to the first artifact but it's different  
17:07 <vmassol> (like not specifying the type and it lookts for a jar when it's actually a xar)  
17:07 <tmortagne> if it still does not look in the local repository with -o then it's definitely a bug since the point of -o is to force Maven to look only in the local repository  
17:08 <tmortagne> yep could be a <type> issue  
17:08 <tmortagne> what error do you get exactly ?  
17:08 <woshilapin> <type> is a jar, I checked  
17:09 <vmassol> yep we need gist/pastebin or both builds  
17:09 <vmassol> s/or/of  
17:09 <woshilapin> Ah  
17:10 <woshilapin> I should do a mvn clean install to install in local, right?  
17:10 <vmassol> clean no but install yes  
17:10 <vmassol> what do yo do?  
17:10 <vmassol> just test? or package?  
17:10 <woshilapin> mvn package would not work ?  
17:10 <vmassol> no  
17:10 <vmassol> it wouldn't  
17:10 <vmassol> package just builds reh jar  
17:10 <vmassol> it doesn't install it in the local repo  
17:10 <woshilapin> OK, this is maybe my problem then (and my eyes are not that good because, there was file in .m2 but not the JAR)  
17:11 <vmassol> (that's install)  
17:11 <woshilapin> (only jar.lastUpdated and other files)  
17:14 <tmortagne> woshilapin: jar.lastUpdated actually been created by maven more or less to indicate it did not found it  
17:14 <tmortagne> (and not retry again)  
17:14 <woshilapin> OK, now the JAR is in .m2 and I have another (weird) error  
17:14 <woshilapin> [WARNING] Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.BannedDependencies failed with message:  
17:14 <woshilapin> XWiki uses SLF4J for logging. Don't use Commons Logging or Log4J.  
17:14 <woshilapin> Found Banned Dependency: log4j:log4j:jar:1.2.16  
17:15 <tmortagne> looks like a clear error to me :)  
17:15 <woshilapin> I guess it's an incompatibility of logger between my project and the project of the partner, right?  
17:15 <tmortagne> we have an enforcer in commons to make sure we don't end up with other logging framework than slf4j  
17:16 <woshilapin> Can I cry? ...  
17:18 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:18 <vmassol> why would you want to cry? it's to help you!  
17:19 <woshilapin> :-)  
17:19 <vmassol> maven is kind enough to tell you that you have a bug  
17:19 <vmassol> (well you could have a bug)  
17:19 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:19 <woshilapin> No, what I understand is that a partner is using this other dependency log4j  
17:20 <vmassol> (depends how you generate your distribution)  
17:20 <vmassol> its not a problem  
17:20 <vmassol> but you need slf4j over log4j  
17:20 <woshilapin> And that it has develop it as XWiki component (so will be run in the wiki)  
17:20 <vmassol> (which we already package in xwiki's distribution)  
17:20 <vmassol> but you must not put log4j in xwik'is WEB-INF/lib  
17:20 <woshilapin> esclude dependency,  
17:20 <vmassol> you just need to do an exclude  
17:20 <woshilapin> esclude dependency?  
17:20 <vmassol> es  
17:20 <vmassol> yes  
17:21 <woshilapin> ok  
17:21 <vmassol> or disable the check  
17:22 <tmortagne> and if this is a XWiki component you should report to them the mistake...  
17:25 <woshilapin> tmortagne, I looked at the dependency tree and it seems it's not the fault of the partner but the fault of a dependency they're using  
17:25 <tmortagne> woshilapin: sure but they should exclude it on their side  
17:25 <woshilapin> vmassol: <exclusions> works like a charm  
17:26 <tmortagne> it's still their fault if their module have this dependency  
17:26 <woshilapin> Ah, ok, indeed  
17:29 <woshilapin> tmortagne, vmassol: thanks  
17:29 <vmassol> yw  
17:31 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:40 <tmortagne> [WARNING] Restarting xwiki.org in 10 minutes  
18:08 <ClemensR> gotta go, should be back tomorrow early (in case my small commit messes somethign up)  
18:09 <ClemensR> of course feel free to rollback in case something sucks ;)
